instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 3115B.... NO Image on LCD
threads.message:
when I plug the power supply, it chimes and there is a light on the screen , but no logo or anything.

I'd appreciate your help

threads.title: 820 3115B.... NO Image on LCD
threads.message:
So you get backlight, but no image?
Any history available?

Check L9080.

threads.title: 820 3115B.... NO Image on LCD
threads.message:
I can see a little carbon on both pins of LCD where  LVDS_CONN_A_CLK_F_N / LVDS_CONN_A_CLK_F_P connected

Voltage on L9080 : 1.21 on Pin 1  and 1.24 on Pin 2

is there any way to clean the LCD connector?

threads.title: 820 3115B.... NO Image on LCD
threads.message:
I was expecting you to check L9080 continuity.

Resolder LCD connector, or change it (if really needed).

threads.title: 820 3115B.... NO Image on LCD
threads.message:
Sorry, My bad...

I ment pins on LCD cable looks damage, and unfortunately, I dont have any other LCD to test
